recent_posts.title: BIP-352 Silent Payments addresses should have an expiration time
recent_posts.summary:
- Josie expresses gratitude to Peter for feedback and acknowledges expiration dates as a general Bitcoin problem.
- Josie suggests proposing expiration dates as their own BIP, supporting various address formats.
- Josie presents skepticism, citing compromised wallets, lost keys, inheritance, missed payments, and metadata leakage.

recent_posts.title: Multipath Keysend
recent_posts.summary:
- ZmnSCPxj proposed a scheme for creating `keysend` protocol on the Lightning-dev mailing list.
- The scheme involves embedding the preimage as TLV 5482373484 in the `keysend`.
- This proposal aims to enhance `keysend` by enabling multipath payments for more flexibility.

recent_posts.title: Blinded Paths Doom Scenario
recent_posts.summary:
- Deanonymizing techniques on the LN reveal the recipient, not the sender.
- Acinq's Phoenix is aware of sender and destination in outbound and inbound payments.
- Blinded paths preserve sender privacy but can be compromised if hops collude.

recent_posts.title: Specification Meeting Transcripts
recent_posts.summary:
- Our team has recorded and transcribed specification meetings since the beginning of the year.
- Transcripts are now available to everyone at [https://btctranscripts.com/lightning-specification].
- Gurwinder from Chaincode helped review and ensure the accuracy of these valuable transcripts.

active_posts.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
active_posts.summary:
- The implementation of 2-of-2 Schnorr Musig2 for statechains is being discussed.
- Party 1 is fully blinded and should not learn certain information.
- Blinded statechains rely on trust in the server and verification of signatures client-side.

active_posts.title: Ark: An Alternative Privacy-preserving Second Layer Solution
active_posts.summary:
- A new protocol called Ark provides an alternative to the Lightning network with no liquidity constraints.
- Ark uses virtual UTXOs and does not require opening and closing channels like Lightning.
- Ark allows users to acquire vTXOs, use lifting, and make anonymous, off-chain payments through an ASP.

active_posts.title: Pull-req to enable Full-RBF by default
active_posts.summary:
- The author proposed enabling full-replace-by-fee (full-rbf) by default in Bitcoin Core.
- Currently, several block explorers, node installations, and well-connected nodes support full-rbf.
- The author suggests enabling full-rbf by default in v26.0 of Bitcoin Core's GitHub master.

active_posts.title: Potential vulnerability in Lightning backends: BOLT-11 "payment hash" does not commit to payment!
active_posts.summary:
- The LNbits team patched an exploit allowing attackers to create balances using invoices.
- Users are urged to update to LNbits version 0.10.5 to prevent similar exploits.
- Developers should implement additional checks and refer to the payment hash as the "preimage hash."

active_posts.title: Jamming Mitigation Dry Run
active_posts.summary:
- We are proceeding with the plan discussed at the summit to conduct a 'dry run' of HTLC endorsement and local reputation tracking.
- The plan involves collecting real-world data for validating local reputation algorithms and simulating attack scenarios.
- We will collect forwarding data, propagate an experimental endorsement TLV, and implement local reputation algorithms.
